articles.title: CERTIFICATE OF AMENDMENT OF ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION
articles.summary: This document is a Certificate of Amendment of Articles of Incorporation for San Jose Amateur Astronomers, filed with the California Secretary of State on August 21, 1970. It details an amendment to Article IV, irrevocably dedicating the corporation's property to charitable and/or scientific non-profit purposes and specifying that assets upon dissolution must go to an exempt fund or foundation, in accordance with Revenue and Taxation Code Section 214. The amendment was approved by both the board of directors in September 1969 and the members in May 1970.

articles.title: State of California
articles.summary: This document is an official certification issued by March Fong Eu, the Secretary of State of California, dated October 7, 1977. It formally attests that an annexed transcript has been compared with the record on file in her office and is a full, true, and correct copy, bearing the Great Seal of the State of California.

articles.title: ENDORSED FILED
articles.summary: This document header indicates a formal filing action, stating that a document was "ENDORSED FILED" on September 29, 1977, in the office of the California Secretary of State, March Fong Eu, and attested by Deputy James E. Harris. It signifies the official recording or validation of a document within a state government agency.

articles.title: AMENDMENT TO ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION
articles.summary: The "Amateur Astronomers," a California corporation, formally amended its Articles of Incorporation in 1977 to officially change its name to the "San Jose Astronomical Association." The resolution for this name change was adopted by both the board of directors and the members, although the members' meeting did not meet the quorum requirement.
